page.title: 02The Greenhouses Landscove
page.content: We visited Mr.Hubbard he said his {greenhouses}covered 18,000 sq.ft.The temperature is controlled by{ ventilators and parifin heaters .He grows two species of{flowers},Pinks and{ Anamones. His house and the church were designed and built in 1851 by { Loughborough Pearson. Each year Mr.Hubbard produces 450,000 blooms .They are driven in lorries to Birmingham Flower Market . The greenhouses were constructed for the growing of{tomatoes},but the subsidising of Dutch growers by the Dutch Government made it uneconomic to grow tomatoes so Mr.Hubbard had to turn to the flower{farming}.
